SEARCH
Package game.body.staticstructs.ground

Class GroundFrame

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.StaticBody
game.body.staticstructs.ground.GroundFrame
Direct Known Subclasses:
GothicFlatDefault, GothicFlatSkull, GothicPillar, GothicSlope, GothicSpikes, HauntedBackdrop, HauntedFlatPlatform, HauntedPillar, HauntedPool, HauntedSlopePlatform, MagicBridge, MagicFloatingPlatform, MagicFloatingRockMedium, MagicFloatingRockSmall, MagicPlatform, MagicPlatformCliff, Prop, TempGround
public abstract class GroundFrame extends city.cs.engine.StaticBody
An abstract class used for all ground objects in the game. Acts as an API for creating and interacting with ground objects.
Since:
30-01-2025
Author:
Alexander Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

  • Constructor Details

    • GroundFrame

      public GroundFrame(GameWorld gameWorld, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 halfDimensions, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 originPos)
      Constructor for the GroundFrame class. Generally used by ground objects which know their dimensions and origin position from the start.
      Parameters:
      gameWorld - The game world to which this ground frame belongs.
      halfDimensions - The half-dimensions of the ground frame.
      originPos - The origin position of the ground frame.

    • GroundFrame

      public GroundFrame(GameWorld gameWorld)
      Constructor for the GroundFrame class. Generally used by ground objects which do not know their dimension and origin position from the start, or require no fixtures.
      Parameters:
      gameWorld - The game world to which this ground frame belongs.

  • Method Details

    • superSetPosition

      protected void superSetPosition(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos)
      Used to call the super class setPosition method. As the super class setPosition method is overridden in this class by setPosition(Vec2 pos).
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to set.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos)
      Sets the position of the ground frame. This method is overridden to ensure that the origin position is set correctly and that the yTop value is reset.

      To use the super class setPosition method, use superSetPosition(Vec2 pos).
      Overrides:
      setPosition in class city.cs.engine.Body
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to set.

    • getHalfDimensions

      public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getHalfDimensions()
      Returns the half-dimensions of the ground frame.
      Returns:
      half-dimensions.

    • getOriginPos

      public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getOriginPos()
      Returns the origin position of the ground frame.
      Returns:
      origin position.

    • getYTop

      public float getYTop()
      Returns the yTop value of the ground frame. yTop - the top y position of the ground frame. (the surface)
      Returns:
      yTop value.

    • resetYTop

      public void resetYTop()
      Resets the yTop value to the top of the ground frame. This method is called in setPosition(Vec2 pos).

    • setYTop

      public void setYTop(float yTop)
      Sets the yTop value of the ground frame. This method is used to set the yTop value manually.
      Parameters:
      yTop - The new yTop value.

    • setPropEnabled

      public void setPropEnabled(boolean propEnabled, int nodeCount)
      Sets the propEnabled value of the ground frame. Nodes allow for props to be added to the ground frame. Node positions are calculated by dividing the width of the ground frame by the number of nodes.
      Parameters:
      propEnabled - The new propEnabled value.
      nodeCount - The number of nodes to create for the prop array.

    • isPropEnabled

      public boolean isPropEnabled()
      Returns the propEnabled value of the ground frame.
      Returns:
      propEnabled value.

    • addProp

      public Prop addProp(Prop prop, int index)
      Adds a prop to the specified index. Displays a warning and deletes the Prop if the array is full, the index is occupied, or the index is out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      prop - The prop to add.
      index - The index to add the prop to. -1 adds to the first available index.
      Returns:
      The prop.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if propEnabled is false.

    • removeProp

      public void removeProp(int index)
      Removes the prop at the specified index. Displays a warning if the index is empty.
      Parameters:
      index - The index to remove the prop from.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if propEnabled is false.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds.

    • repaint

      public void repaint()
      Removes all attached images from the ground frame. Calls the paint() method to repaint the ground frame.
      See Also:
      • AttachedImage

    • getPos

      public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getPos()
      Gets the position of the ground frame.
      Returns:
      The position

    • randRangeFloat

      public static float randRangeFloat(float min, float max)
      Returns a random float between the specified min and max values. This is inclusive of both min and max.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value.
      max - The maximum value.
      Returns:
      A random float between min and max.

    • randRangeInt

      public static int randRangeInt(int min, int max)
      Returns a random integer between the specified min and max values. This is inclusive of both min and max.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value.
      max - The maximum value.
      Returns:
      A random integer between min and max.

    • paint

      public abstract void paint()
      Handles the creation of attached images for the ground frame. Used for the initial creation of the ground frame.
      See Also:
      • AttachedImage

    • isDestroyed

      public boolean isDestroyed()
      Checks if the ground frame is destroyed.
      Returns:
      true if the ground frame is destroyed, false otherwise.
